'''Hunters' Gathering''' is the second part of {{Quest|Silent Night}}.

==Steps==
# Head to the game venue indicated in the script
# Continue heading over to the game venue
# Gather information at the tavern in the capital
# Explore the nearby area
# Gather information at the central square of the capital
# Head to the depths of the forest
# Go further in
# Go to the area where the monsters have appeared
# Defeat the monsters
#* Wave 1: {{Enemy|Thundercraven Rifthound Whelp|x=2}}
#* Wave 2: {{Enemy|Praetorian Golem|x=1}}

==Gameplay Notes==
* During steps 3â€“9, the active party will be limited to the Traveler and a trial Furina, Lyney, and Navia.
* In "Easy Mode," every time the player makes a check, the "check difficulty" value will be added to their randomly drawn number, therefore guaranteeing success. This does not apply to "Combat" checks.
* While roleplaying, the player's appearance will change depending on which skills they chose to learn.<!-- If both "medicine" and "cooking" are chosen, appearance depends on how the player chooses to introduce themselves -->

;(Approach the game menu)
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Whoa! They really have thought of everything. Even the Fateometer is here and ready to go for us!
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 furina 01.ogg}} '''Furina:''' ...The Fateometer? What's that?
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 lyney 01.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' It's a card that's used to determine action success or failure. We'll need to use it when we try to use certain skills.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' And what about all the dessert and tea? Is that for us as well?
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' That's what the message said.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 furina 02.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Really? That's so nice... It feels just like a tea party with friends.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Those snacks have Paimon's name written all over them!
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 lyney 02.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Haha, I think you might be more of a "Snack Hunter" than a [[Marechaussee Phantom|Marechausee Hunter]], Paimon.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Snack Hunter Paimon, reporting for duty! If there are delicious snacks to be found, Paimon'll track down every last one!
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 furina 03.ogg}} '''Furina:''' The desserts are great, but I'm still looking forward to the story more than anything.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Very fair. Then let us begin.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' First, please pick up the blank character cards in front of you, and write down your name and profession.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 04.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' You can find an abbreviated version of the rules printed on the back of your character card. If you have any questions, feel free to ask me.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 05.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' In this story, everyone is a Marechaussee Hunter. To reflect this, the club has prepared a small badge for everyone.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 03.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Ooh! Nice!
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 06.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' As Hunters, you have proficiency in swordsmanship and fighting by default, so there's no need to allocate any additional skill points to those areas.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 04.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Swordsmanship? So there's a fighting part to all of this? Umm... Paimon's not sure she can do all that on her own. Maybe Paimon can just stick with you?
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 07a.ogg}} {{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 07b.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Why don't you share a character card, then? {{Traveler}} will be the Marechaussee Hunter and you can be {{MC|m=his|f=her}} little floating assistant.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Hahaha, kinda like in real life.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 furina 04.ogg}} '''Furina:''' So, for the name... Do I fill it out with the name of my character?
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 08.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Yep. It can be any name you like.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 navia 04.ogg}} '''Navia:''' You can use your real name too, if you want. I do that whenever I get too lazy to think of a new name.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 furina 05.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Oh! So, it would be like... like experiencing a different life, but still as yourself? That's not a bad idea.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 lyney 03.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Hmm, in that case... I think I'll continue to use the name "[[Lyney]]," then.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 clorinde 09.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Next up is the skill sheet. You have a limited amount of skill points that you can use to learn a number of skills. The more points you invest in a particular skill, the easier it will be to pass associated checks.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 navia 05.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Hmm, I'll take "persuasion" and "investigation"! Those are must-haves when it comes to missions like these.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 05.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Oh, those skills sound like they'd be useful for gathering intelligence. Good idea [[Navia]]! Just as expected of a veteran player!
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 furina 06.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Hmm... So should we also take those skills, then?
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 lyney 04.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Not necessarily. Since we're working together as a team, we could leave the negotiations to Navia, and use our skill points to pick up other useful skills.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 lyney 05.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' For example... I think I'll take "stealth" and "sleight of hand." That will give us more options if we run into any situations we can't negotiate our way out of.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 furina 07.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Oh, interesting! I wasn't thinking about it like that. I suppose it's not so different from an acting troupe, everyone has their own role to play.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 furina 08.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Let me see... I'll take "arts" and "performance." I'm not quite sure what use they'll be, but I'm not as knowledgeable about the other skills, and I'm not too confident I'd be able to roleplay them well.
:{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 06.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Well, that leaves us! What do you want to learn, {{Traveler}}?
:{{DIcon}} Learn "medicine"...
::{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 07a 1.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Ooh, so you want to help people when they're injured? That's nice of you!
::{{DIcon}} Learn "cooking"...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 07c 1.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Hehe, gotta say, this suits you really well! Nothing boosts morale like good food!
::{{DIcon}} Learn "insight"...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 1 paimon 07b 1.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Ohh, something that will help you get a read on other people's thoughts! Sounds useful!

:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Let's see... Hmm... Oh, looks like you each have enough points to choose one final skill.
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' You've all picked such classic skills! It's fine to go a little bit out of the box, you know.
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' (...Why do I get the feeling she's getting ready to cause trouble...)
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' For example... This one here! "Summon"! Doesn't it sound super mysterious and cool?
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 furina 01.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Oh, I saw that one just now as well. The description says... "This skill can be used under certain circumstances to summon characters or creatures that fit the script's worldbuilding rules."
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 lyney 01.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' The script's worldbuilding rules, huh... But, how are we supposed to know what a Marechaussee Hunter can summon?
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' That's not for us to worry about, my friend! Just learn the skills that interest you, and the GM will take care of the rest!
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' ...
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Alright, you've convinced Paimon... Let's learn "Summon," then! Paimon can't wait to see what kind of thing shows up.
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 04.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' ...Well, now that everyone's more or less finished creating their characters, we can begin.
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 05.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Since two of our players are doing this for the first time, though, let me ask...
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 06.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Would you like to play on "easy mode," or "authentic mode"?
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 furina 02.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Oh, what's the difference between the two?
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 07.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Well, in roleplaying games, the story sometimes changes based on the decisions of the players and the results of the Fateometer.
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 08.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' For example, if you "fail" a check, that means you cannot use the target skill in that scenario. A "critical failure" may even result in further negative consequences.
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 09.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' If you choose to play in "authentic mode," every time you elect to use a skill, you'll need to use the Fateometer to see whether you succeed or fail, and face any consequences that may follow.
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 10.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' If you choose "easy mode" instead, every check will be successful by default, and you won't have to worry about luck playing a factor.
:;(Open [[#Tutorials|Tutorial]])
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 furina 03.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Hmm... Given that I'd like to focus on the story, I suppose I should pick "easy mode." I'd feel bad if I brought the team down by failing my checks...
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 navia 04.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Huh? C'mon, don't worry about that! RNG is the lifeblood of roleplaying games! I'm going with with "authentic mode" for sure!
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 navia 05.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Never knowing what you might have to overcome... Doesn't that sound exciting?
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 furina 04.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Um... I&mdash;I'd rather be mentally prepared for what might happen...
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 11.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Alright. Then I'll mark down [[Furina]] for "easy mode." All her checks will be successful by default. As usual, Navia and Lyney will play on "authentic mode."
:{{A|vo cllq002 2 navia 06.ogg}} '''Navia:''' What about you, dear partner? How would you like to play?
:{{DIcon}} I'd like to pick "easy mode"...
::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 12a 1.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Are you sure?
::{{DIcon|Talk OK}} Yep, I'm sure.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 lyney 02a 1.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Mhm, no need to worry about the pesky Fateometer. Pretty good choice if you just want to relax and play the game.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 navia 08.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Honestly, I don't think [[Clorinde]] would make things too difficult for us no matter what the Fateometer says... Isn't that right, Clorinde?
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 14.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' No promises.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Uh... That wasn't super reassuring!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 navia 09.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Well, anyway, enough talk! Let's get started! I want to experience at least a good chunk of the story today.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 furina 05.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Speaking of the story... Why is the beginning scene on a beach?
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 15.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Well, that's because...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 16.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' A long time ago, back when human civilization was still in its infancy, powerful demons and evil sorcerers ruled over the land. They created a host of monsters and sent them to slaughter all humans in existence...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 17.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Soon, a group of human rebels banded together. With their swords raised, they swore to brave the darkness and, in doing so, subdue each and every monster that sought their destruction. They became known as the Marechaussee Hunters...
::{{DIcon}} Let me think about this some more...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 12b 1.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Take your time. There's no rush.
:::;(Dialogue returns to option selection)

:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 16.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' A long time ago, back when human civilization was still in its infancy, powerful demons and evil sorcerers ruled over the land. They created a host of monsters and sent them to slaughter all humans in existence...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 17.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Soon, a group of human rebels banded together. With their swords raised, they swore to brave the darkness and, in doing so, subdue each and every monster that sought their destruction. They became known as the Marechaussee Hunters...
::{{DIcon}} Let me think about this some more...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 2 clorinde 13b 1.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Take your time. There's no rush.

:{{A|vo cllq002 3 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Some time later, as a member of the Marechaussee Hunters, you receive a commission. Following the address provided on the message, you take a boat and arrive at this strange city.

:{{A|vo cllq002 3 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Your eyes meet, and you realize these people are fellow Marechaussee Hunters, likely led to this location after receiving the same commission as you.

:{{A|vo cllq002 3 lyney 01.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Okay! Count me in.
:{{A|vo cllq002 3 lyney 02.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' My name is Lyney. I've been wandering since I was little, and picked up a few less than legal tricks along the way. I was adopted by a Marechaussee Hunter and, later, chose to follow in his footsteps.

:{{A|vo cllq002 3 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Hey, that's really cool!
:{{A|vo cllq002 3 navia 04.ogg}} '''Navia:''' (You can do it, Furina! That's exactly how it's done!)
:{{A|vo cllq002 3 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Paimon is Paimon, a good friend and companion to this Marechaussee Hunter right here!

::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04b 4.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' Those monsters are camped outside the city, and they've been destroying all our trade routes.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04b 5.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' We have limited reserves within the city, so if this continues, we're all going to be in big trouble.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03b 1.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Wait, you're saying no one has put a plan in place to distribute supplies or maintain order?
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04b 6.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' Hah, we could all starve, and those nobles in the palace wouldn't even break a sweat.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04b 7.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' Who knows? Maybe they've been in cahoots with the monsters all along.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 lyney 03b 5.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' That is concerning...
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 lyney 03b 6.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Thank you, sir. We won't take up any more of your time, now.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 paimon 02b 1.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Hey, why did you leave in such a hurry?
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 lyney 03b 7.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Weeeell, you see, that bottle of "wine" was just a cardboard prop.
:{{DIcon}} Furina, put on a performance!
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03c 1.ogg}} '''Furina:''' (A performance? I've never played a roleplaying game like this before, but even I can tell that suggestion is pretty far-fetched. Is a performance check really going to help here?)
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03c 2.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Um... Alright. Ahem...
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03c 3.ogg}} '''Furina:''' By the harbor's grace, a lone boat lies in rest, let the moon give chase, for here begins our quest.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03c 4.ogg}} '''Furina:''' In the dark of shadow, our heroes seek to find, where creatures born of evil, weave their grand design.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03c 5.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Blocked the road does stand, such is our hunters' plight, yet with sword and courage in hand, they march forth to pierce the night.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04c 1.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' Hmph, I don't recall asking for a bardic song. Don't expect me to give you any coin.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04c 2.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' But if you meant what you sang, and you are indeed some kind of hunter... Then by all means, please go out, and kill those monsters for us.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04c 3.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' Those monsters are camped outside the city, and they've been destroying all our trade routes.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04c 4.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' We have limited reserves within the city, so if this continues, we're all going to be in big trouble.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03c 6.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Wait, you're saying no one has put a plan in place to distribute supplies or maintain order?
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04c 5.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' Hah, we could all starve, and those nobles in the palace wouldn't even break a sweat.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04c 6.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' Who knows? Maybe they've been in cahoots with the monsters all along.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 lyney 03c 1.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' That is concerning...
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 clorinde 04c 7.ogg}} '''Gruff Merchant:''' Alright, I think I've said more than enough. Be on your way, now.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03c 7.ogg}} '''Furina:''' ...Got it. Thank you, sir.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 paimon 02c 1.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Don't mind him, Furina. He just doesn't have enough taste to appreciate your art.
::{{A|vo cllq002 8 furina 03c 8.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Oh, no, I was just thinking about... how those nobles must be so cold-hearted. It's like they don't care about their people at all!
:{{A|vo cllq002 9 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Should we try to go somewhere with more people?
:{{A|vo cllq002 9 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Ooh, how about the city square! Follow me!

;(Approach the city square)
:{{A|vo cllq002 10 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Before you lies the city's central square. You see a man with a slightly anxious look on his face pacing back and forth, his head hanging low.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' He doesn't seem to notice your approach. Still immersed in his own thoughts, he shakes his head and lets out a long sigh.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 furina 01.ogg}} '''Furina:''' (This guy seems promising enough. Maybe I can get some information out of him!)
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 furina 02.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Hello, sir! Is there anything I can do to help you?
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' ...
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Wait, you're...!
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 furina 03.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Erm, I'm...
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 04.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Oh, dear goodness, you're... you're a Marechaussee Hunter!
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 lyney 01.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' You recognize us? Ah, are you... one of the people who wrote the commission letter?
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 05.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Yes, yes! I didn't expect you to actually come. What great news... The city is saved!
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 furina 04.ogg}} '''Furina:''' What happened here?
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 06.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Alas... We once lived comfortable, carefree lives. This city used to be free of monsters. The first Marechaussee Hunter, [[Cassiodor]], the "Golden Hunter," he was the one who drove them back.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 07.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' However... Monsters have once again surrounded the city. Perhaps the seal that kept them at bay has lost its power, or perhaps an evil sorcerer has been meddling in our affairs. All I know for sure is that their return has stripped this city of any chance at peace.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Are there... not enough soldiers to drive them out?
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 08.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' It's not a question of numbers. The guards simply have no idea how to deal with them.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 09.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Most people my age have never even seen one of the monsters, much less been trained to fight against them. What's worse, many of us don't even know the history of the Marechaussee Hunters anymore.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 10.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' When I was child, though, my grandfather would tell me stories about how the Marechaussee Hunters drove back the monsters. So, on the off-chance that something might come of it, I decided to reach out to you.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 11.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' To be perfectly honest, I was starting to think all those stories were just tall tales, but now that I've seen you in person, I finally know that it was true!
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Well, you can rest easy, friend! The righteous and formidable Marechaussee Hunters are on the case!
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 12.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The man is touched by your determination and resolve. His eyes begin to well with tears of relief.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 furina 05.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Still, if we're going to hunt the monsters, we need to know where to find them. Can you give us any leads?
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 13.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' All I know is that the area outside the city is dangerous. I'm afraid I can't point you toward a specific location.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 14.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Although, if you leave the capital through the main gate and follow the road, you should run into a group of guards. They might know more about where to find the monsters.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' I see... We'll go look for them, then.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 15.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Alright, be careful. Oh and... one last thing. The monsters outside the city are just part of the problem. There are evil sorcerers inside the city as well, so be on your guard.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 16.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' They're actively working with the monsters, and have corrupted the court ministers with malicious magic. They're the reason why, even inside the city, everything has been a giant mess.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 17.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Even one of our kindest ministers has turned into a boorish and unreasonable figure, interested in nothing but enacting laws that exploit the people. Who knows how much longer we'll be able to go on like this...
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 lyney 02.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Talk about being stuck between a rock and a hard place...
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 navia 04.ogg}} '''Navia:''' I feel bad for him. Maybe we should try to cheer him up?
:{{DIcon}} I could cook something?
::{{A|vo cllq002 11 furina 06a 1.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Hey, not everything can be solved with food!
:{{DIcon}} Furina could sing him a song?
::{{A|vo cllq002 11 furina 06b 1.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Huh? Like... now? Is this really the right time...?
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 18.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' I appreciate your kindness, but for now, it's more important to focus on the crisis at hand.
:{{A|vo cllq002 11 clorinde 19.ogg}} '''Anxious Man:''' Brave Hunters, I leave the future of this kingdom to you.
<!-- special screen transition -->
----
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 furina 01.ogg}} '''Furina:''' If I understood correctly, there are currently two problems in the kingdom that need solving, right?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 lyney 01.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Exactly. We need to defeat the monsters outside the city and take down the evil sorcerers stirring up trouble from within.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' But, which problem should we tackle first...
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Well, this seems like a good moment for a break. Take some time, and discuss what you want to do. Let me know when you've made your decision.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 furina 02.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Huh... I really didn't expect the people in the city to keep us at arm's length like that. I totally thought the Hunters would be treated like heroes.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Well, Clorinde said the script took cues from the real history of Fontaine, right? Maybe the real-life Marechaussee Hunters were also treated like that?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' I wouldn't say it's a perfect representation of history, but there are definitely some similarities. Would you like to hear more about it?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Sure, as long as it doesn't spoil anything in the script! You've brought up bits and pieces of the Hunters' history before, but it was all in passing.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Paimon wants to know, too! The Hunters were super powerful, right? Were they all from a special line of supernatural beings or something? Kinda like... the [[youkai]] in [[Inazuma]]?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' No, all Marechaussee Hunters were ordinary mortal fighters. The only thing that set them apart were the special sword techniques passed down over the centuries.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 paimon 03.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Huh? So you mean... anyone could become a Marechaussee Hunter?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 04.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' In theory, yes. All you would need to do is survive the rigorous training, and master the swordsmanship techniques required to fight the monsters.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 05.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Still, most people dropped out at the early stages, and others called it quits the minute they saw a monster in person. To become a Hunter, you must be strong in both body and mind.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 paimon 04.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' What kind of monsters did the Hunters fight exactly? Oh and, the "evil sorcerer" the script mentions &mdash; did they exist in real life, too?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 06.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' The land of Fontaine once played host to an ancient dynasty known as [[Remuria]]. After that dynasty fell, monsters began to appear, intent on obstructing humans from establishing a new social order.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 07.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' One of the ancient sorcerers of Remuria used his power to assemble a formidable army of [[Praetorian Golem|golems]]. He sought to use that force to establish himself as king.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Now wait a second! Don't tell me that guy was the inspiration for the evil sorcerer in the script! We still haven't found any in-game information on him yet, so why don't you talk about someone else for now?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 08.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Well, I wasn't planning on going into anything you might be able to find out in the game... But, if you want me to talk about something else, then... How about Cassiodor, the Golden Hunter, or [[Egeria]], the ex-Hydro Archon?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 paimon 05.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Wait, but those people are all from a super long time ago! Where did you learn all this, Clorinde?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 09.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' From my master.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 04.ogg}} '''Navia:''' By "master," you mean... Ms. [[Petronilla]]?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 furina 03.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Someone you know?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 05.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Absolutely. Ms. Petronilla and my father were good friends. Back in the day, she would often bring Clorinde over to play. But then...
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 10.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' ...Let's not get off topic. Anyway, back to what I was saying...
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 11.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Responding to Egeria's call, a number of warriors followed Cassiodor into battle against the monsters. This group of warriors, under Cassiodor's leadership, became known as the Marechaussee Hunters.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 12.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Yet, as Fontaine entered an era of peace, their work gradually became obsolete. The Marechaussee Phantom, originally an association made up of Hunters, eventually came to be predominantly comprised of [[Melusine]]s.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 lyney 02.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Ah, I see... That explains why most of the people in the script have forgotten the Hunters or think of them as nothing more than a legend.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 furina 04.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Is that really a bad thing, though? It can get tough always being the one shouldering everyone's expectations.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 lyney 03.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Hmm, depends on who you ask, I suppose. If the name of the organization no longer commands respect, investigative work is bound to suffer.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 06.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Speaking of investigations, which problem should we tackle first? Monsters, or evil sorcerer?
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 furina 05.ogg}} '''Furina:''' I vote monsters. That's the main duty of the Hunters, right? We can come back to the sorcerer later.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 lyney 04.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Well said, Miss Furina. Plus, if the sorcerer really are the masterminds behind this whole thing, defeating the monsters could give us some clues on their intentions as well.
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 07.ogg}} '''Navia:''' What about you, partner? What do you think?
:{{DIcon}} I also vote monsters.
::{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 08a 1.ogg}} '''Navia:''' It's decided, then!
:{{DIcon}} The sorcerer problem seems pretty important...
::{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 08b 1.ogg}} '''Navia:''' I mean... you're not wrong. But, those characters are usually the ones pulling the strings behind the scenes. More often than not, they're very formidable opponents. Going after them now might be jumping the gun a little bit.
::{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 08b 2.ogg}} '''Navia:''' We don't want a total party kill on the first day, right? With Clorinde as the GM, I wouldn't rule out the possibility...
::{{DIcon}} ...You've "persuaded" me.
::{{A|vo cllq002 12 navia 08b 3.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Haha, then it's settled! Let's go hunt some monsters!
:{{A|vo cllq002 12 clorinde 13.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Alright, after some discussion, you decide to turn around and head out of the city...
<!-- special screen transition -->
----
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Let's take a look around, like that guy said...
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''???:''' You there! Outsiders! Halt!
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Whoa! Wh&mdash;Who's there?
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' An armored man approaches you. He has a tall, muscular build and a determined expression in his eyes. Just one look, and you can tell he's fought in his fair share of battles.
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Although he's trying his best to conceal his current state, his uneven gait and the sweat dripping down his forehead make it obvious that he's been wounded and is in serious pain.
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 04.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I'm the captain of the guard. I saw you sneaking around the city earlier, so I'll only ask this once...
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 05.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' State your purpose, or it's off to the dungeons for the lot of you!
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 paimon 03.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Wow, it's been a while since someone's been this suspicious of us...
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 06.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I said talk! Not whisper between yourselves!
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 furina 01.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Er... Have you ever heard of the Marechaussee Hunters?
:{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 07.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Marechaussee Hunters? Hah, that fairy tale, you mean? What, you expect me to believe you're one of them?
;(If medicine was chosen as a skill)<!--Ttedja - Cooking and insight on authentic mode -->
:{{DIcon}} I'd like to do a medicine check to see if I can help him...
:;(If Check was a critical success)
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 furina 02.ogg}} '''Furina:''' What? A critical success? Your luck is through the roof today....
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 26.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' ...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 27.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' As you begin to survey the man's condition, you're immediately able to see past the crude dressing on his leg and assess the inside of his wound.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 28.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' You've seen many such injuries before. If not properly treated, the man will likely fall victim to serious illness for the rest of his life.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 29.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Seeing your serious expression, the man's brow begins to furrow.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 hero 03.ogg}} {{A|vo cllq002 13 heroine 03.ogg}} '''{{Traveler}}:''' I'm a doctor by trade &mdash; please let me redress your wound. You don't have to suffer like this.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 30.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' You apply a poultice of specialized medicine to the gash, and carefully redress the wound. The man regards you first with bewilderment and then with guilt.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 31.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Thank you, friend. I'm sorry for misjudging you earlier. Please accept my apology.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 furina 03.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Don't worry about it! That misunderstanding is all in the past now.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 paimon 05.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' So, do you know where we can find the monsters? We're here to defeat them.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 32.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' He informs you of the locations of the monsters, and a glimmer of hope returns to his eyes.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 33.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Those monsters aren't easy to deal with. Our soldiers are too young to be of much help, and now I'm out of commission as well...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 34.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' But... But if the legendary Marechaussee Hunters are prepared to lend us their strength, then perhaps there's still a chance to turn the tides, after all!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 navia 05.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Just take it easy and leave the monsters to us! Fighting them is what we do.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 35.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I'll place my trust in you, then. You have my gratitude.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 36.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I just hope all the guards will be able to come back to their families alive. I wish you the best of luck.
:;(If Check was a success)
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 08.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Using your knowledge of medicine, you're able to deduce that the injury on his calf was a monster's doing, and the wound has already begun to fester. As you check him over, he looks at you with suspicion and retracts his injured leg further back.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 hero 01.ogg}} {{A|vo cllq002 13 heroine 01.ogg}} '''{{Traveler}}:''' I'm a doctor by trade &mdash; please let me redress your wound. You don't have to suffer like this.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 09.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The man appears somewhat disgruntled at having been exposed, but soon relents and raises his leg for you to take a better look.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 10.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' He allows you to apply a poultice of specialized medicine to the wound, and it appears to bring him much relief. The tension in his brow eases.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 11.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Alright... Guess you lot might actually be real Marechaussee Hunters, after all. In any case, you've successfully treated my wound. So, what do you want to know?
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 paimon 04.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Do you know where we can find the monsters? Or the other guards who are fighting them?
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 12.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' He informs you of the various locations where monsters have appeared. He looks in that general direction with a pained gaze, as if a thin, invisible thread is pulling on his wound.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 13.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Some of our new recruits have never even dealt with a petty thief, and now they're out there fighting monsters... *sigh* If it weren't for this cursed leg...!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Please, sir, don't get too worked up. You need to focus on your recovery. Just leave the monsters to us &mdash; we're Marechaussee Hunters, after all.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 14.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Hearing you say that, a glimmer of hope flashes in his eyes. But, it disappears almost as quickly as it came.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 15.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Those monsters aren't easy to deal with. But... if you insist on going, I won't stop you, either.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 16.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I just hope all the guards will be able to come back to their families alive. I wish you the best of luck...
:;(If Check was a failure)
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 17.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' With some suspicion, the captain allows you to survey his condition after you announce yourself as a trained doctor.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 18.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Unfortunately, you're unable to adequately assess the source of his injury, much less come up with a way to relieve his pain.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 hero 02.ogg}} {{A|vo cllq002 13 heroine 02.ogg}} '''{{Traveler}}:''' I'm sorry... My skills are a little rusty.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 19.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Well, this is no ordinary wound... it was inflicted by a monster. Now, tell me, are you truly... a Marechaussee Hunter?
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 20.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' He regards you with suspicion for quite some time, before shaking his head. Perhaps he's finally accepted that you're here to help.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Sir, we were indeed in the city earlier, but our purpose was only to gather information on the monsters. We're here to help this city and all the people within it.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Your guards are still fighting the monsters as we speak. They could be seriously wounded and in grave need of support. You need all the help you can get!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 21.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The man regards you with doubt and concern. After a period of inner struggle, he lets out a long sigh, and informs you of the locations where the monsters have appeared.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 22.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Some of our new recruits have never even dealt with a petty thief, and now they're out there fighting monsters... *sigh* If it weren't for this cursed leg...!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 navia 04.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Please, sir, don't get too worked up. You need to focus on your recovery. Just leave the monsters to us &mdash; we're Marechaussee Hunters, after all.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 23.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Hearing you say that, a glimmer of hope flashes in his eyes. But, it disappears almost as quickly as it came.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 24.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Those monsters aren't easy to deal with. But... if you insist on going, I won't stop you, either.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 25.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I just hope all the guards will be able to come back to their families alive. I wish you the best of luck...
:;(If Check was a critical failure)
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 lyney 01.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Ah, a critical failure. Unlucky timing...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 37.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The captain of the guards reluctantly allows you to assess his condition. Right as you're trying to get a closer look at his leg, your hand slips, and collides against his wound with great force...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 38.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' ARGH!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 paimon 06.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' That sounds like it hurt...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 hero 04.ogg}} {{A|vo cllq002 13 heroine 04.ogg}} '''{{Traveler}}:''' I'm sorry... My skills are a little rusty.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 39.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The captain recoils and takes a half step back. He stares down at you, panting heavily, his eyes full of anger.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 40.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I don't care what you have to say, or why you're here. You are not welcome in this city.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 41.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Get out of my sight. Now!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 navia 06.ogg}} '''Navia:''' I understand that you're upset, sir! We'll leave soon, I promise. It's just, if we don't know where to find the monsters, we won't even know where to go...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 42.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Hah, don't tell me you're actually considering fighting one of those things?
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 43.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' You know, put any other group of young people in your place, and I might have tried to stop them, but since you're the ones asking...
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 44.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' He informs you of the locations of the monsters with a disdainful tone, as if he's certain you have no chance of making it out alive.
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 paimon 07.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Phew, that was scary... Paimon was worried that critical failure meant we weren't gonna learn anything!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 navia 07.ogg}} '''Navia:''' It's all thanks to Clorinde's quick thinking!
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 45.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Well, are you leaving or not?
:::{{A|vo cllq002 13 lyney 02.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' We're leaving, we're leavingï¼
:{{DIcon}} We're counting on you, Navia!
::{{A|vo cllq002 14 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Sir, we were indeed in the city earlier, but our purpose was only to gather information on the monsters. We're here to help this city and all the people within it.
::{{A|vo cllq002 14 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Your guards are still fighting the monsters as we speak. They could be seriously wounded and in grave need of support. You need all the help you can get!
::{{A|vo cllq002 14 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The man regards you with doubt and concern. After a period of inner struggle, he lets out a long sigh, and informs you of the locations where the monsters have appeared.
::{{A|vo cllq002 14 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Those monsters aren't easy to deal with. But... if you insist on going, I won't stop you, either.
::{{A|vo cllq002 14 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I just hope all the guards will be able to come back to their families alive. I wish you the best of luck...
;(If insight was chosen as a skill)
:{{DIcon}} I'd like to do an insight check to tell what he's thinking...
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 46.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' While everyone is talking, you begin to carefully observe the captain's mannerisms.
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 47.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Every so often, you see him glance toward a particular direction with a pained expression on his face, as if an invisible thread is tying him to an unknown place.
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 48.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' As you follow his gaze, you vaguely recall that the location he seems fixated on is known for its difficult terrain. Any battle that breaks out in a place like that is likely to be prolonged and devastating.
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 hero 05.ogg}} {{A|vo cllq002 13 heroine 05.ogg}} '''{{Traveler}}:''' Is that where the monsters are? Outside the forest, in the area with the difficult terrain?
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 49.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The captain is taken aback by your sudden question. Still, his shock only lends credence to your theory.
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 50.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' You're... looking to fight the monsters?
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 navia 08.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Well, we're Marechaussee Hunters, after all. You could say that's basically our job!
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 51.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' He shakes his head and continues to regard you with skepticism. In the end, he decides to inform you of the locations where the monsters have appeared.
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 52.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' Those monsters aren't easy to deal with. But... if you insist on going, I won't stop you, either.
::{{A|vo cllq002 13 clorinde 53.ogg}} '''Guard Captain:''' I just hope all the guards will be able to come back to their families alive. I wish you the best of luck...
:{{A|vo cllq002 15 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Based on what the captain said, the monsters should be right up ahead!
:{{A|vo cllq002 15 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Let's go. Hopefully we're not too late.

;(Approach the injured guards)
:{{A|vo cllq002 16 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' As you approach the battlefield, you see numerous people lying by the side of the road. They appear to be dressed like guards.
:{{A|vo cllq002 16 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Their faces are filled with desperation and terror. Some are screaming and cursing in vain, as if still trying to banish the monstrosities they saw from their minds.
:{{A|vo cllq002 17 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' A few of the wounded look up at you in shock and disbelief.
:{{A|vo cllq002 17 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' "Quick! Leave this place. Turn around and don't look back!" They yell.

;(Approach the marked location)
:{{A|vo cllq002 18 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' This is the place he mentioned... right?
:{{A|vo cllq002 18 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' You see broken iron swords scattered all around you and downed trees riddled with terrifying claw marks.
:{{A|vo cllq002 18 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' All the signs point to one thing &mdash; a truly devastating battle just took place here.
:{{A|vo cllq002 18 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Be on your guard, everyone. The monsters might still be around...
:{{A|vo cllq002 18 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Before you can finish your sentence, you hear rustling sounds from the surrounding bushes. The monsters have emerged.
:{{A|vo cllq002 18 clorinde 04.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' They close in on you without fear. You get the impression that, in their bloodthirsty eyes, you're just another meal for them to devour.
:{{A|vo cllq002 18 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Argh! L&mdash;Little help here! This thing wants to eat Paimon!
:{{A|vo cllq002 18 clorinde 05.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Your battle round begins... now.

;(Make a "Combat" check)
;(If Check was a success)
::[Check success] Combat power increased...<!-- What does this actually entail? -->
;(If Check was a failure)
::[Check failure] Combat power remains unchanged...

;(After defeating the first wave of enemies)
:{{A|vo cllq002 19 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The next battle round begins... now.

;(After defeating the second wave of enemies)
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' The monsters lets out a terrifying roar of anger and resentment, before dissipating into thin air.
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Phew... Thank goodness it's over!
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 lyney 01.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' We're lucky the Marechaussee Hunter class came with all those preset skill points. Otherwise, we would've been in some real trouble.
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 furina 01.ogg}} '''Furina:''' I never knew the Fateometer even determines the amount of damage you inflict... If you get unlucky, isn't it just game over right then and there?
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Hehe, that's part of the fun! The uncertainty of fate is what gives these games their appeal.
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Just as you begin to celebrate your victory, a suspicious lump on the ground catches your attention.
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' A suspicious... lump? Wait, could it be... the thing that appears after every battle...!?
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' I walk up to it, crouch down, and begin to carefully examine it. I've still got my right glove on, so it should be fine for me to touch it, right?
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' As you investigate the mound, you discover that the exposed portion appears to be made of wood. It was previously obscured by the large form of the monsters.
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 clorinde 04.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' With the monsters gone, the small protrusion now awaits your discovery, poking out of the ground like a shy flower bud.
:{{A|vo cllq002 20 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Woah! It's a treasure chest!
:{{DIcon}} Let's dig it up!
<!-- special screen transition -->
----
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' With everyone's help, you successfully excavate the wooden chest from the ground.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Game Master:''' Even without opening it, you can tell from the mora and jewels scattered around the chest that it must contain quite the fortune.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 01.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Makes sense! We worked hard for this! Let's open it, and we can share what's inside!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 01.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Haha, I can understand your excitement, Paimon, but think about it... Doesn't it seem like there are people out there who need this treasure more than us?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Yeah! Think about all the people suffering in the capital or all those guards who got hurt fighting the monsters... Wouldn't it be better if we gave the treasure to them?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 02.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Wait, is that how it works? Paimon thought, since we were the ones to dig it up, we could just take it for ourselves...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Well, let's put it this way... Any decision you make during a roleplaying game can impact the future course of the story.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 01.ogg}} '''Furina:''' But, would the people really believe us? It's hard enough for us to prove we're Marechaussee Hunters. What if they think we procured the treasure illegally? They might get even more suspicious of us...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 02.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' That's definitely something we should consider. Maybe we can come up with an explanation in advance...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 03.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Well, if donating it could cause that much trouble, why don't we use it to buy some gear and fill up on good food? Then, we'll be ready to fight even more bad guys!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 03.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Looks like you're facing a difficult choice once again.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 04.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Well, it's getting late. Why don't we call it a day for now.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 02.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Wow, where did the time go...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 03.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Haha, I'm not sure if it's because I'm having so much fun with you all, or because the story is particularly enticing... But, I feel like I could almost keep going.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Hear, hear! Ooh, how about we play through the night!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 03.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Huh!? Oh, um... I'm not sure I'll have enough energy for that...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 04.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Yeah, that won't work for me, either. [[Lynette]] will give me an earful if I get home too late.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 05.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' I understand how you feel, Navia, but we have to change venues for the next part of the story, anyway.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 04.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Huh? Another location?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 06.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Mhm. There's a special note for the GM at the end of this section that says to proceed to an indoor set for the next part of the script.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 05.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Woah, they really pulled out all the stops for this new script!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 04.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Well, even if we end the game for the day, we can still stay a little longer and hear Clorinde finish her story, right? Paimon wants to hear more about the history of the Hunters...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 04.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Hmm, something tells me you just want to finish the free desserts before we break for the day...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 05.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Th&mdash;That's just a coincidence, okay? Besides, to Paimon, not finishing free food feels even worse than having to buy her own!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 06.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' And anyway, Paimon really does want to hear more about Clorinde's master!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 06.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Well...
:{{DIcon}} If the story doesn't have a happy ending...
:{{DIcon}} It's okay not to finish it...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 07.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' It's nothing. I appreciate the concern, but it's all in the past. It won't do any harm to share these things now.
<!-- time passes -->
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 08.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' My earliest memories are of living with Master. According to her, she saved me from certain people of ill repute. My birth parents had left me behind some time before that.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 05.ogg}} '''Furina:''' (What a heavy beginning for a life story...)
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 09.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Master was a fascinating individual, if... inexperienced in the ways of raising children.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 10.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' My first ever toy was a short sword. Although, I suppose it wasn't so much a toy as something Master removed from her waist and handed to a noisy child in need of distraction.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 06.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Wait, so she... handed an actual sword to a child? Isn't that dangerous!? Did you hurt yourself?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 11.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Of course I did. I cut my palm, and bled quite a lot. But Master was not concerned. She just stood there and casually lectured me about it&mdash;
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 12.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' "See? That's what you get for not holding the sword properly," she told me. She then crouched down next to me and said, "Give me your hand. I'll teach you to bandage this wound. After that, it's time to learn how to truly hold a blade."
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 05.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Excuse me for asking this, Clorinde, but... how old were you, exactly, when all of this happened?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 13.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Probably around... three? Give or take.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 07.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Three!? Isn't that when most kids are still struggling to hold a fork?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 14.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' As I said, Master was... rather inexperienced in the ways of raising children. She believed trial and error was the best way to teach a child what they're capable of.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 06.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' (I'm not so sure this is a question of "experience"...)
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 15.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' I didn't see anything wrong with her ways at the time, and, anyway, children don't get to choose how they're raised... Oh, she did bring me back a pet from [[Liyue]] once. It was a [[Geovishap Hatchling]].
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 07.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' A Geovishap Hatchling!? For a pet!? That seems even more dangerous!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 16.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' What she said was this &mdash; "Make sure to get along, you two. If you really can't agree on something, just settle it with a fight. Whoever loses is the real pet."
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 07.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Uh... And how old were you when this happened?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 17.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Five.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 08.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Well... Did you win?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 18.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' No, I lost.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 08.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' So you're saying... You actually became... the Geovishap's pet?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 19.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Yes, but only for a week. By the end of that week, I defeated it in combat, and we've shared a cordial relationship ever since.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 09.ogg}} '''Furina:''' (That really doesn't sound like the kind of childhood someone should have...)
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 20.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Later on, I gradually understood that Master most likely didn't know any other way to raise a child. She was a Marechaussee Hunter, but I never heard her bring up her own parents.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 21.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Thanks to her, I learned how to navigate the forest by the age of six, and could hunt monsters in the wild by myself the year after that.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 22.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Even though the training she subjected me to was strict, she always made sure to take me traveling when she had the time. We met many of her friends during those days... That was also how I met Mr. [[Callas]] and his family.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 07.ogg}} '''Navia:''' I still remember the first time we met. You were too scared to join our picnic and hid behind Ms. Petronilla the whole time.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 23.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' I still... hadn't really met many children my age at that time, so I didn't know how to interact with others.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 08.ogg}} '''Navia:''' After that, though, you started coming over a lot. You loved challenging people to shooting competitions, remember? I don't think many members of the Spina ever beat you in one of those.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 24.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' I had a lot of fun during those days.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 09.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Hehe, I enjoyed them too! Oh, do you remember that one time we went exploring around the [[Spina di Rosula|Spina]] together? We overheard Papa call your Master Fontaine's "Protector of Justice."
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 10.ogg}} '''Navia:''' We tried to pretend like we never heard anything, but you nearly let it slip that one time, hahaha...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 10.ogg}} '''Furina:''' "Protector of Justice"? Wait, you mean... that vigilante hero from twenty years ago? The one who was always active at night?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 25.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Yep, that would be her. She would often put on a black cloak and go out at night. I never knew where she went or what she was doing... until, like Navia said, we overheard the truth from Mr. Callas that night.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 11.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Twenty years ago, huh... I still remember the [[Garde]]s leaving all kinds of witness reports about her on [[Neuvillette]]'s desk.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 26.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' My apologies.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 12.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Oh... There's no need to apologize! You had nothing to do with it. And, anyway, everything she did was for a good cause.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 13.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Although, calling herself the "Protector of Order" was a bit much, especially when she deliberately operated outside the law...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 09.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Huh? When did the "Protector of Justice" become the "Protector of Order"?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 14.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Oh, she had a bunch of codenames. I heard she would just come up with a name on the spot whenever she was asked...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 15.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Later on, she probably got sick of answering those questions and decided to stick to just two &mdash; the "Protector of Justice" and the "Protector of Order."
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 27.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' That sounds like her, all right. I bet she forgot which of the two she'd used by the time she got back each night.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 08.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' Well, she certainly sounds like a fascinating individual. With her strong sense of justice, it's no surprise her student followed in her footsteps.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 28.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' It's true. I always wanted to become like her. Someone powerful, independent, and with a strong sense of conviction... But...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 09.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' But...?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 11.ogg}} '''Navia:''' ...
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 29.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' ...She suddenly disappeared the night I turned ten years old.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 10.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Disappeared!? What happened?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 30.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' I have no idea. She didn't even leave a note. I was never able to find out where she went.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 31.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' That night, I was celebrating my birthday at Navia's house, but Master never came to pick me up. When I returned home on my own, it was to an empty house.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 32.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' When she still didn't appear after a few days, I went to Mr. Callas' house to ask about her whereabouts, but he only shook his head.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 12.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Papa probably didn't know, either. I know he sent a few people to investigate the matter in secret, but... they never found any credible leads.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 33.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Don't worry, I understand. To be perfectly honest, given Master's personality and way of doing things, it all made a lot of sense. If I had to guess, I'd say she probably used it as an opportunity to force me to become independent.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 34.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Just like how... when a litter of kittens reaches a certain age, the mother willingly leaves them behind.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 16.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Were... Were you upset, Clorinde?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 35.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' I was at first, but not anymore. I don't believe Master would suddenly disappear for no reason. There must have been something she just had to do.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 paimon 11.ogg}} '''Paimon:''' Well, despite everything, you still managed to follow in her footsteps and become the greatest [[Champion Duelist]] in all of Fontaine! You're practically a living symbol of law and justice!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 36.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Hmm, I suspect my position would be far too "by-the-books" for her. Master always did whatever she pleased. But... you're right. I suppose I do take after her in some ways.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 17.ogg}} '''Furina:''' (Who knew Clorinde had such an interesting past... I never had the chance to ask her about it before.)
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 18.ogg}} '''Furina:''' (I wonder.. If Clorinde's master were the Champion Duelist back then... Would that duel against Mr. Callas have gone differently?)
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 19.ogg}} '''Furina:''' (Oh no... Judging by the atmosphere, Clorinde and Navia are probably thinking something similar. The mood just got super awkward all of a sudden...)
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 13.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Well, anyway! Would you look at the time? It's getting dark, so we should probably call it a day for real this time. If we keep talking like this, we really will be here all night!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 lyney 10.ogg}} '''Lyney:''' I had a great time today, Miss Clorinde. Thank you for being our GM.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 37.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Anytime.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 14.ogg}} '''Navia:''' The script was good, but I've got to say, your childhood stories were even better!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 navia 15.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Hey, you should tell us more about that fight against the Geovishap some time! Maybe your master was onto something, hehe!
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 38.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Hm, you could be right.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 20.ogg}} '''Furina:''' (What does she mean, "onto something"? I certainly don't know any five-year-olds who want to fight a vishap in their spare time!)
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 21.ogg}} '''Furina:''' Guess I'll head back as well. I need to save my energy if I want to continue enjoying the story tomorrow.
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 clorinde 39.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' You're that excited to hear about my fight with the vishap?
:{{A|vo cllq002 21 furina 22.ogg}} '''Furina:''' I was talking about the script!
;(Quest completes)

;(Talk to Clorinde or Navia, optional)
:{{A|vo dialog cllq002 navia 01.ogg}} '''Navia:''' Um... Just between the two of us, could you tell me what it was like to be the Geovishap's pet?
:{{A|vo dialog cllq002 clorinde 01.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' It was nothing special, really. Geovishaps don't understand the concept of a "pet." So, basically, it just headbutted me whenever I entered its territory.
:{{A|vo dialog cllq002 navia 02.ogg}} '''Navia:''' And that... hurt?
:{{A|vo dialog cllq002 clorinde 02.ogg}} '''Clorinde:''' Yeah, it hurt. What, something you want to experience for yourself?
:{{A|vo dialog cllq002 navia 03.ogg}} '''Navia:''' I'm good, thanks!
{{Dialogue End}}
